officialName: Board of Zoning Appeals General Information
purpose: This document provides general information about the Board of Zoning Appeals (BOZA) process, including when an appeal is necessary, how to apply, and what to expect during the hearing process.
whenRequired: When a building or occupancy permit is denied by the Milwaukee Development Center due to zoning ordinance restrictions.
When seeking a Special Use authorization.
When requesting a variance from the literal requirements of the zoning ordinance.
When the planned use of a property is classified as a special use or is not permitted by the zoning ordinance.
fees: $100 pre-application filing fee.

purpose: This permit allows construction projects to begin work on the below-grade structure before the final building permit is issued, specifically for excavation, foundations, and structural parts up to the first floor level.
whenRequired: When starting work on the below-grade structure before the final building permit is issued.
For excavation work.
For foundation work.
For structural parts not higher than the first floor level.
For residential unit new constructions.
fees: Plan examination fees (see fee schedule).

fields.name: Construction documents (4 sets)
fields.description: Plans prepared and sealed by a design professional (WI registered architect or engineer) if the building volume exceeds 50,000 cubic feet. Each set must have original seal and signature. An additional set is required for projects needing Health Department review or located in renewal, planned development, or historic districts.

fields.name: Plat of survey (7 copies)
fields.description: Surveys showing proposed improvements with original stamp and signature of the registered land surveyor.

fields.name: Letter of supervision
fields.description: Letter from the design professional if the volume of the proposed building is 50,000 cubic feet or more.

fields.name: Specifications (1 copy)
fields.description: One copy of specifications.

fields.name: Structural calculations (1 copy)
fields.description: Structural calculations stamped and signed by the design professional.

fields.description: Completed worksheets and required deposit.

fields.description: IBC worksheets for the project

fields.name: Plumbing plans
fields.description: Plumbing plans submitted to a plumbing plan reviewer.

fields.name: Storm water management plan
fields.description: Required if development/redevelopment/subdivision of land 1 acre or larger is proposed, or if development adds 1/2 acre or more of impervious area.

purpose: This form is used to apply for a permit to erect or affix a sign to a building in Milwaukee, ensuring compliance with zoning and building codes.
whenRequired: When erecting a new sign.
When affixing a sign to a building.
When altering an existing sign.
When replacing a sign.

fields.name: Site plan or survey
fields.description: Show the location of the sign(s) being submitted for permit as well as the location and footprint of significant buildings on the site. The plan must show the dimension from the sign base to the property line. If the sign is to be mounted on a building, the diagram must indicate to which wall the sign will be affixed.

fields.name: Location of nearby signs
fields.description: Diagram that shows the location of off-premise signs within 200 feet of the proposed sign, if applicable.

fields.name: Drawing of the sign
fields.description: Dimensioned drawing of the sign, including all copy and graphics. Note materials, color, mounting, illumination and other significant details. Note if a corporate logo is being depicted. For ground signs, show the full elevation with dimensions to indicate overall height and where the sign box is placed.

fields.name: Details of the sign supports
fields.description: Information about footing or anchoring specifications. Roof signs and unusual signs may require supporting engineering information.

fields.name: Building elevations
fields.description: If a sign is to be affixed to a building, provide a diagram showing the sign in its correct dimensions on the building façade. Include its height above grade, and proximity to other features such as windows, doors, and the building parapet. Photos are helpful.

fields.name: Cost of job
fields.description: Accurate estimates of the cost of each sign for which a permit is requested.

officialName: Commercial to Residential (UDC) Conversion Permit Requirements
purpose: This document outlines the permit requirements and processes for converting commercial buildings to residential use under the Uniform Dwelling Code (UDC) in Milwaukee.
whenRequired: When changing the use of a building from commercial to residential (1- or 2-family dwelling)
When renovating 3- or 4-unit apartments into 1- or 2-family buildings
When creating 1 or 2 dwellings from a commercial building in mixed-use occupancies
When seeking code variances for UDC compliance in a conversion project
prerequisites: New Construction, Residential application (RES-NEW)
Wisconsin Uniform Building Permit Application (WI form SBD-5823) if seeking variance
Petition for variance form (WI form SBD-9890X) if seeking variance
relatedForms: Wisconsin Uniform Building Permit Application (WI form SBD-5823)
Petition for variance form (WI form SBD-9890X)
estimatedCompletionTime: Varies depending on the complexity of the project
fees: Fees assessed per Milwaukee Code of Ordinance (MCO) 200-33 and MCO 81-6, based on work area.

officialName: Automatic Fire Extinguishing System Plan Review and Permit Submittal Req.
purpose: This form outlines the requirements for submitting plans and obtaining permits for automatic fire extinguishing systems in the City of Milwaukee.
whenRequired: Before installing an automatic fire extinguishing system in a building located within the City of Milwaukee.
To ensure compliance with City of Milwaukee Code requirements.
To comply with State Code requirements.
To meet NFPA standards.
When submitting drawings for review.
fees: The plan review fee is calculated at 0.6% of the cost of the system, with a minimum fee of $60 (max. fee $5,500). The permit fee is calculated at 1.5% of the cost of the system, with a minimum permit fee of $75.

fields.name: Drawings
fields.description: Drawings submitted must be drawn by computer or with standard drafting equipment. Hand drawings will not be accepted

fields.name: Scale
fields.description: All drawings must be to scale, and the scale must be identified on the drawings

fields.name: Dimensions
fields.description: Important dimensions must be indicated by value, i.e. feet and inches

fields.name: Contrast
fields.description: The drawings must have enough contrast so that all lines and lettering are readable and able to be scanned for record.

fields.name: Designer Signature
fields.description: All plans submitted must be signed by the designer and wet stamped

fields.name: Floor Plan
fields.description: A floor plan of the room where the system is located. The plan must at least include the location of the hood or other equipment protected, the location of the exit or exits from the room, the location of the system, and the location of the remote activation station.

fields.name: Isometric
fields.description: An isometric or isometrics showing the system type, size, and manufacturer; pipe sizes and lengths; nozzle sizes and locations; hood size and location; plenum and duct sizes; and the kitchen or other equipment protected.

fields.name: All Relevant Dimensions
fields.description: All relevant dimensions must be indicated.

officialName: Kitchen Ventilation Plan Review and Permit
purpose: This form is required to install a commercial kitchen ventilation system in a building located within the City of Milwaukee, and to show compliance with State Code Chapters Comm. 64 and 65 (HVAC and Fuel Gas) and NFPA 96.
whenRequired: Before installing a commercial kitchen ventilation system within the City of Milwaukee.
To show compliance with State Code Chapters Comm. 64 and 65 (HVAC and Fuel Gas).
To show compliance with NFPA 96 (Standard for Installation of Equipment for the Removal of Smoke- and Grease-Laden Vapors from Commercial Cooking Equipment).
When the building in which the kitchen hood is to be installed exceeds 50,000 cubic feet in volume.
When drawings do not meet the specified standards.
fees: A plan review fee is required, and the permit fee will be based on the equipment installed and the make-up air unit heat input.

fields.name: Site plan showing the location of the building, property lines, and ventilation system
fields.description: A site plan showing the location of the building, property lines, and ventilation system. This is necessary to show compliance with code requirements that limit ventilation opening locations with respect to property lines and other buildings.

fields.name: Location plan showing where the kitchen ventilation system is to be installed within the building
fields.description: A location plan, showing where the kitchen ventilation system is to be installed within the building. This plan does not have to replicate the entire building construction, but must indicate where the ventilation system will be located in the building, and must identify any code issues relative to the ventilation system location.

fields.name: Isometric or orthogonal (plan, section, elevation) drawings showing such items as: the grease hood; grease hood construction materials; plenum and duct; insulation; clean-outs; exhaust and make-up air fans; make-up air unit; make-up air unit size in CFM and BTU
fields.description: Isometric or orthogonal (plan, section, elevation) drawings showing such items as: the grease hood; grease hood construction materials; plenum and duct; insulation; clean-outs; exhaust and make-up air fans; make-up air unit; make-up air unit size in CFM and BTU.

fields.description: Any other relevant information needed to determine compliance with State Code requirements.

purpose: Provides guidelines for submitting plans for review and obtaining permits for new commercial buildings and additions in Milwaukee, ensuring compliance with building and zoning codes.
whenRequired: For all commercial construction projects (excluding Federal or State-owned buildings, hospitals, and nursing homes).
When plans for a new commercial building or addition need review for compliance with the State Building Code.
When municipal building and zoning code compliance needs to be verified.
When energy worksheets are required for the building envelope.
Before permits can be issued for new buildings, additions that are slab on grade construction, or footing and foundation work.
estimatedCompletionTime: Varies depending on the project complexity.
fees: See fee schedule online

fields.name: Construction Documents
fields.description: Four (4) sets of construction documents. Plans must be prepared and sealed by a design professional, a Wisconsin registered architect or engineer if the volume of the proposed building is 50,000 cubic feet or greater. Paper plans must bear an original signature of the design professional on each set.

fields.name: Landscape Drawings
fields.description: Four (4) sets of landscape drawings, bound into the construction set, are required for projects involving (1) industrial and manufacturing uses adjacent or across the street from residential, institutional, parks, non-industrial planned development zoning districts, (2) parking areas within 25 feet of a street, (3) motor vehicle display or storage, (4) outdoor storage, (5) Dumpsters/Mechanical Equipment.

fields.name: Plat of Survey
fields.description: Four (4) copies of the Plat of Survey. These surveys should be to scale and show the proposed improvements and have an original stamp and signature of the registered land surveyor who prepared it.

fields.name: Certificate of Supervision
fields.description: The Certificate of Supervision of the design professional if the volume of the proposed building is 50,000 cubic feet or greater.

fields.name: Specifications
fields.description: One (1) copy of specifications.

fields.name: Erosion Control Plans
fields.description: Erosion control plans, completed worksheet, and the required surety deposit.

fields.name: Structural Calculations
fields.description: One (1) copy of structural calculations stamped and signed by the design professional who prepared them.

fields.name: Energy Worksheets
fields.description: Energy worksheets from SPS 363 of the state building code for the building envelope.

fields.name: Plumbing Plans
fields.description: Plumbing plans must be submitted for approval to the plumbing plan reviewers in the Development Center.

fields.name: Plan Examination Fees
fields.description: Plan examination fees (see fee schedule) and a completed plan review application form.

purpose: This application is used to obtain a permit for re-roofing work in the City of Milwaukee, ensuring compliance with building codes and regulations.
whenRequired: When performing re-roofing work on a building.
When the re-roofing involves changes to the structural system.
When the re-roofing results in an increased dead load of 5% or more.

When removing above-deck insulation and replacing with new insulation.
prerequisites: Plans and specifications (may be waived under certain conditions).

Separate Department of Public Works permits (if needed for street occupancy).
fees:

Processing Fee: $20

purpose: This document outlines the requirements and process for renewing a building permit in Milwaukee.
whenRequired: When a building permit has expired.
When work will continue beyond the two or three-year limit of the original permit.
When the permit holder wishes to continue work under the original terms.
When the original permit work is not complete but the permit is about to expire
estimatedCompletionTime: Varies depending on project size and complexity
fees: 1% of the cost of the remaining construction work, minimum fee is $50 for one/two family dwellings & accessory structures, $80 for all other structures.
